Asking if Japanese cultura has "sins" and how that influenced the bushido c=
ode could be a good start point, as it would also be=C2=A0asking about=C2=
=A0medieval Buddhism and its ideas=C2=A0of "sins".
But maybe what=C2=A0 in =
Western world would=C2=A0parallel bushido is not Christianity but code of c=
hivalry, =C2=A0or knighthood.=C2=A0 There would there the best English equi=
valent, =C2=A0instead of "sin".
On the other side, one thing were=C2=A0idea=
s=C2=A0of =C2=A0good and wrong=C2=A0 in bushido as well as=C2=A0 in the Eur=
opean=C2=A0code of chivalry=C2=A0 at their peak, 13 or 14 Centuries.=C2=A0=
=C2=A0Things become different when=C2=A0 by end of those=C2=A0ages=C2=A0 th=
e bushido=C2=A0or =C2=A0the code of chivalry were=C2=A0matter of some thoug=
ht and nostalgia. Sure by then everyone wanted to think only about virtues.=
 So no "sins" or "wrongdoing" in bushido texts, all them =C2=A0written afte=
r 18 Century.
=C2=A0

You would be better off=
 asking if Japanese culture has "sins" and how that
. I recommend looking u=
p the word
"tsumi".
On Aug 16, 2011 6:13 PM, "Junshin" <snowkane@...>=
 wrote:
> I have a question, and please be gentle, it's not really a histor=
y
question in the truest sense.
>
> The Question: Do Samurai have Sins?
>
>=
 I ask this because I'm trying to research them, and all I come across is
S=
amurai Virtues. That's fine I guess- I'm a budding writer and you need to
k=
now the good things to, but for the life of me I can't find the appropriate=

list of matching Sins.
>
> Christianity as a whole has Sins and Virtues, a=
s do most religions and
cultures in the world. They always come as a matchi=
ng pair. So if Samurai
have Virtues based on Bushido and the like, it would=
 stand to reason they
have Sins, too. But I can't find them.
>
> So...do th=
ey exist, and I'm just missing them? If so, does anybody know
what they are=
?
